bibl.title: Known and Unknown Officials.
bibl.note: With the exception of No. 8 all the other texts were found during the excavations of the University of Michigan at Karanis. Several of the texts originated in other localities. - 1. Inv. 6352. Petition to Gaius Valerius Eudaimon, Prefect of Egypt, Concerning Rent. Antinoopolis, ca. 142/43 A.D. - 2. Inv. 2872a. Petition to Quintus Aemilius Saturninus, Prefect of Egypt, Concerning Trespass. Spring (?), A.D. 197. The text is a duplicate of P. Mich. VI, 422; it belongs to the archive of Gaius Julius Niger. - 3. Inv. 2789a + b. Proceedings before the Prefect Claudius Julianus. Heracleopolis (?), between A.D. 203-206. - 4. Inv. 6354a. Petition to Aurelius Appius Sabinus, Prefect of Egypt, Concerning Land. Ca. 249/50 A.D. - 5. Inv. 5478a. Document Mentioning the Prefect Statilius Ammianus. Between A.D. 271-276. - 6. Inv. 4658a. Text Mentioning Valerius Ziper, praeses Herculiae. A.D. 320. - 7. Inv. 6807a. Petition to Tiberius Claudius Arius, Strategus of the Arsinoite Nome. Between A.D. 98-100. - 8. Inv. 217. Declaration of Sheep and Goats. Arsinoë, A.D. 144/45. - 9. Inv. 2868a. Petition to the Strategus Theodoros Concerning Theft. A.D. 158/9. - 10. Inv. 5336. Document Mentioning Two Strategi of the Arsinoite Nome, Heracleides Division. Ca. A.D. 152. - 11. Inv. 5458a. Nomination of Liturgists. Between A.D. 196-198. - 12. Inv. 5299a. Nomination of Liturgists. Philadelphia, ca. A.D. 215/216. - 13. Inv. 6324a. Nomination of (a) Liturgist(s). Post A.D. 304. - 14. Inv. 4788b. Nomination of Liturgists (Komarchs?). Ca. A.D. 310. - 15. Inv. 5529. Nomination of (a) Liturgist(s). Oxyrhynchos, IV A.D. - 16. Inv. 6460a. Report to Hermophilus, Royal Scribe of the Heracleides Division of the Arsinoite Nome. Between A.D. 181-185. - 17. Inv. 4788a. Petition to Ailius Eutyches Alias Kleon, Nomarch of the Arsinoite Nome. Soknopaiu Nesos, II century A.D. - 18. Inv. 3029a. Petition to Flavius Paulus, Logistes of the Oxyrhynchite Nome. Oxyrhynchos, ca. A.D. 381. - 19. Inv. 6260a. Text Mentioning the Dikaiodotes Petronius Catullinus. III/IV century A.D. - 20. Inv. 6546b. Declaration to the bibliofÊlakew §gktÆsevn. A.D. 84-96. - 21. Inv. 5865a. Declaration to the bibliofÊlakew §gktÆsevn. Between A.D. 222-235. - 22. Inv. 5298a. Document Mentioning Annius Diogenes, Procurator of the Heptanomia. 25.2.-26.3. A.D. 301. - 23. Inv. 5275a. Receipts for the Annona. July 25-August 23, A.D. 216. - 24. Inv. 6244. End of a Petition. March 10, A.D. 331. - 25. Inv. 4603. End of a Deed of Surety. July 30, A.D. 360. - 26. Inv. 6345a. Beginning of a Document. December 21, A.D. 381. - Pp. 203-204, n. 2: mentions three examples of uninformative texts: a. Inv. 5987b. A.D. II(/III); - b. Inv. 5478b. A.D. III; - c. Inv. 5838a. A.D. II/III. <bibliophulakes egkteseon>
